column4: I uninstalled TeamSpeak but .teamspeak2 folder still exists. Can I remove it? Why doesn't Ubuntu automatically delete it?
I uninstalled TeamSpeak but .teamspeak2 folder still exists. Can I remove it? Why doesn't Ubuntu automatically delete it?
How do I make to delete app folders when I uinstall a n app?
apt-get remove --purge  to remove everything the program is creating (not in ~)
because you are using it "wrong" witouht --purge apt-get is not removing conffiles
I used ubuntu software center to uninstall it
there should be also the option for purge
hm, dont know, i never use a gui for sotware-management
i guess its called teamspeak-client and teamspeak-server
its only removing conffiles which are created with postinst, rules and so on, nothing you created by starting the program like configs in the home-dir
i told you already what purge is doing
echo $PATH  everything it that directorys can be accessed directly
